Question
========

In an American study, the temperature of a number of patients was measured in degrees Fahrenheit. The standard deviation is reported as a given value *s*. We express the values in degrees Celsius, by subtracting 32 from all values and multiplying the result by 5/9. Then, for the standard deviation of the new values, the following

Answerlist
----------

* Remains equal to s
* Becomes 5/9 × s + 32
* Becomes 5/9 × s
* Becomes 25/81 × s

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* Remains equal to s: Incorrect
* Becomes 5/9 × s + 32: Incorrect
* Becomes 5/9 × s: Correct
* Becomes 25/81 × s: Incorrect
